patches.reasoning: Addressing misconceptions helps clarify common misunderstandings pupils might have about the topic.

value.misconception: All Romans left Britain immediately after AD 410
value.description: Not all Romans left immediately; some stayed behind. The lesson will explain the gradual nature of the departure.

value.misconception: Britain was left in chaos immediately after the Romans left
value.description: Although there were challenges, many Roman systems continued to influence Britain. The lesson will highlight this continuity.

value.misconception: The Saxons invaded immediately after the Romans left
value.description: The Saxons' arrival was gradual, and their influence took time to establish. The lesson will discuss this timeline.

prompt.value: Misconceptions have been added to ensure pupils understand the gradual and complex nature of Roman Britain's end. Now, let's define the keywords for the lesson.
